Example 17.9. Sturgeon growth rate.

The growth of female Atlantic sturgeon (fish) in the Hudson River, New York, approximately follows the differential equation

\begin{equation*} \dfrac{dL}{dt} = 19.56e^{0.074t} \end{equation*}

that describes its length \(L\) in cm as a function of its age \(t\) in years.

  1. How much does the fish grow between ages \(t = 0\) and \(t = 10\text{,}\) its first ten years?

  2. How much does the fish grow between ages \(t = 10\) and \(t = 20\text{,}\) its second ten years?

  3. In which period did the fish grow the most?

  4. How much does the fish grow between ages \(t = 0\) and \(t = 20\text{?}\)

in-context
